Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrightonColin
Reviews.Content: Despite reading some very negative reviews of this hotel, we decided to book anyway because the location and price were ideal for our budget. This is a small hotel but beautifully presented. The staff were extremely pleasant and very helpful. The rooms are typically Parisien but ours was ideal (room 34) overlooking the Opera House - if you had the balcony door open you could hear them practising - it was fanstastic. The breakfast is great too as it was included in the price - plenty of fresh fruit, yoghurt, cereal, ham, cheese, fresh bread, boiled eggs (hard or soft), fresh juice, coffee, tea etc. The lady who worked breakfast shift was very friendly and very helpful. Location of this hotel is ideal - within 3 minutes walk to the Bastille, very close to the nearest metro and everything very close. We took the open bus tour to see all of the sights from the Bastille on our first day and then took the metro/train to the Palace of Versailles on the second day - stopping off on the way back to some of the sights we had seen from the bus tour. A fanstastic city that doesn't have to cost a fortune if you eat/drink just of the main squares/streets. We found restaurants in the Latin quarter which were priced from 10 euros to 35 euros for 3 courses, however, if you want to spend more, there are plenty of places where you can spend your money.

Reviews.Title: “Can definitely recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizvincent
Reviews.Content: Stayed here fo 4 nights. Found reception staff very pleasant and helpful. Room very comfortable and clean. Excellent location (new one to us) and only a few moments to the Bastille Metro on Line 1 to Louvre/Tuileries/Champs Elysees. Within walking distance of Left Bank and Notre Dame. Lots of restaurants in Bastille area. Decent French buffet breakfast. Pleasant courtyard entrance to hotel. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: FloridaWineaux
Reviews.Content: During our 4 day stay at this hotel there were 4 different people at the front desk. Each one of them was not friendly at all. Unfortunately we had to leave our key with them each time we left and then pick it up when we came back into the hotel to get in our room. I kept hoping each time we did that....that at least one of them would be a little friendly....but not... On our first day I asked politely if I could have another pillow and the woman at the desk rolled her eyes and said something in French to the other woman standing there. Even though we were within very close walking distance to the metro..once on it... it felt like we had to take several trains each time just to get to the area where most of the sites were. We paid for breakfast each morning, but wish now that we hadn't. It was nothing to write home about...very basic. Our room was small but clean and the bathroom looked like it was fairly new. One night we were going to walk to a restaurant a couple of blocks away and realized when we got in the lobby that it was raining. We saw an umbrella stand with 5 or 6 umbrellas in it and asked the guy at the front desk if we could borrow one and he said no that we had to buy one. Needless to say we went back up to our room and got our own umbrella. On our last morning there we had to leave very early to get to the airport so I went down to the breakfast room to get some coffee for myself and my husband. Even though it was an hour or two before breakfast was to be available the coffee was already done....which probably explained why it tasted like mud on the other mornings. I was in the room maybe 10 seconds and the night desk clerk came hurrying in and said that I could not get the coffee...it wasn't time. But he said that there was coffee upstairs...in the lobby. I followed him up there and he showed me where I could get coffee but that I would have to pay for it. Seriously?? Even though we paid for the breakfast that morning, but were leaving before it started, we couldn't even get coffee from the breakfast room....we had to pay for the coffee in the lobby?? Needless to say we left without getting coffee. While in the lobby, I realized that there was a security camera for the breakfast room....I guess they thought you would steal some of the stale crossiants and awful coffee. They did have free internet on one computer down in the basement breakfast room. Of the 4 days we were there though, it only worked one day. All and all staying here kind of colored my stay in Paris in a not so great a light. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, would definitely use again.”
Reviews.Author: DrHWest
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, soundproofed, airconditioned room. Room a little small, but clean and comfortable. Excellent breakfast, very helpful staff. Brilliant location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Our first time in Paris, this well-designed, clean, friendly hotel was perfect”
Reviews.Author: hr_department
Reviews.Content: so my husband and i went on a last minute trip to paris. was able to book this hotel just 1 month in advance. it was more expensive than i was hoping to spend, about $275/night with taxes. but no complaints. if i could have booked a couple months in advance i probably would have stayed in a VRBO. but of what was available it was the best cost, best location that i could surmise from reviews. and i wasn't disappointed when i arrived via the garde de lyon train station. just a short walk to the hotel, this neighborhood is charming and full of adorable restaurants. a cute boutique hotel with just 4 or so floors. we stayed in a double room overlooking the rear of the building on the second floor. the room was more spacious than expected, the bed was very comfortable. the bathroom was small, but the sink, shower, toliet were very new and modern. the best part was the double french windows that opened up! so parisian - or at least what an american expects. the staff was very friendly and all spoke english. this is literally 1 block from the canal and less than a 5 minute walk to the metro station (bastille). this is a great location, just south and on the eastern border of the marais. i would recommend this neighborhood restaurant - Chez Janou - must try, small, bustling and very authentic. you can't go wrong staying here. i promise you'll enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location for clean, renovated hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeripateticCanadian
Reviews.Content: Tiny rooms but to be expected in Paris - very clean and good value. Steps to Bastille metro with 3 metro lines was handy to get around. Breakfast is E12 so we bought at Supermarche down the street. Easy access to CDG airport via Air France shuttle to Gare Lyon and then easy departure to Gare du Nord for trains out of town. All in all, met our needs well. Too bad they couldn't control the unusual rainy weather (all week long!!). Our room was directly on rue de Lyon but had the most amazing sound proofing windows that block most of the street noise. It wasn't a problem at all - we could hear the neighbours more than the cars.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked it and would return”
Reviews.Author: jimmymac67
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very well presented, stylish, and very clean. The staff were all welcoming and pleasant. The continental breakfast had lots of choice and was of excellent quality and quantity. The area was very pleasant with good bars and cafes a few minutes away. The bastille Metro station was only a 5 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine.”
Reviews.Author: TimothyF
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel near the Opera bastille and you cant get much nearer than this just across the road! It is an easy walk to gare de Lyon, minutes from a metro station and right on the marais quarter. So it ticks all the boxes for location. Reception was friendly and helpful and the small public area was clean and attractive. Room was no smaller than any Paris 3* and perfectly adequate size. Bed was queen size and one of the most comfortable we have found in Paris. TV, minibar a decent wardrobe and a couple of chairs. What more do you need. Room was clean and decor fresh, soundproofing excellent and the aircon worked well. Bathroom with a ( rare in Paris) real, if small, bath. toileteries, towels etc all fine. We didnt take the breakfast but it looked good. Free wifi and a useable if slow PC available for guests use In all the hotel did not disappoint. For a place to stay in a good paris location at a reasonable price I could not fault it

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Marie31774
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in late May, and were extremely pleased with our experience. Yes, as other reviewers noted the room (street side, 2nd floor) was on the small side, but so are most other Paris hotel rooms, and this one was very well appointed with comfortable bed and clean as a whistle. And quiet too, especially for a busy street--love those French double-paned windows! The breakfast may be the most bountiful we've seen in Europe with even a gizmo to soft boil eggs to your own preference. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, and spoke English a lot better than our ragged French. The location may be short on romantic charm (just a block away from Bastille and across from the new starkly modern opera house), but more than made up for that with convenience. Literally steps away from the Metro for slightly further destinations, but very do-able to walk to Ile St-Louis & Ile de la Cite, the Marais, Canal St. Martin boat dock, the Seine or into the Latin Quarter. We would not hesitate to recommend Hotel Pavillon Bastille to friends or to stay there again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: LouiseSkavlebo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and quiet with a friendly helpful staff. I had read other reviews on this hotel before booking so I knew the room would be small however it did have everything we needed. A large bathtub, shower, flat screen TV and a desk. Our room faced the street and we found the room to be so quiet! The breakfast although I found it to be pricey, was very good as well. The hotel was steps away from the Metro and only 2 stops from the Louvre. We also did walk to Notre Dame and many other sights, it was wonderful to walk along the river at dusk. I have recommended this hotel already and will stay there on my next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Um cantinho encantador. - A charming corner.”
Reviews.Author: barroca35
Reviews.Content: Simpático e acolhedor - Nice and warm My wife and I were very pleased with the hotel, its facilities and location. The attendants very helpful and courteous. Near the subway station and also from Gare de Lyon. What we needed for our stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: alansquirrell
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly, helpful & efficient..& a great location..best hotel in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “We received very good service and assistance during the time of the strikes and demonstrations in France.”
Reviews.Author: GFM7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is elegantly furnished with comfortable rooms. The staff are attentive and pleasant. The location is relatively quiet but within easy walking distance of amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet, relaxing and very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Gilly21
Reviews.Content: Ideally placed for walking to bars, cafes, restaurants and taking trip on barge on Canal St Martin. Metro nearby but walk into centre of Paris only 20 minutes. Hotel staff very weloming, room fabulous - spacious, very clean and wonderful brand-new bathroom. No complaints at all, although the facility to make a cup of tea/coffee in the roon would have been appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great, little boutique place that puts Paris at your dispoal”
Reviews.Author: soubrettina
Reviews.Content: My colleague recommended this hotel to me. He's stayed in it before and is wonderful at finding affordable places to stay that have a little personality (or at least aren't some large, predictable chain) all over Europe. I had relatively easy, efficient communication with the hotel via email prior to my arrival when booking my stay and got the room at a good rate. There are a couple hotels on this little stretch of Rue de Lyon that are quite similar (small, boutique, and one has a name that's very similar to this one). It's a clean, pleasant place on the outside. The lobby is small, but clean, organized, and cheerful. When I arrived, I was a bit early and my room wasn't ready yet. The woman behind the desk took my suitcase and let me know when I could come back. And she helped me with some directions so I could run an errand or two in the meantime. When I came back, it was ready. My room was small (I didn't expect it not to be; it's France), but nicely appointed. There was plenty of room for me (and a guest one night when a friend came to visit) during what little time we spent in the room. There was a closet with a good amount of space, desk with chair (Unfortunately wifi isn't free), chair, and a nicely comfy bed. The room had central air (and heat, I suppose, but it was summer when I was there). The bathroom wasn't massive, but was again, what I expected. There was actually a bathtub (which isn't always the case). And I appreciated the heated towel rack. There was a nice, little view out into the hotel courtyard at the front (facing Rue de Lyon). The staff during the day was immensely helpful. They helped me find somewhere to buy a new mobile SIM card (and even helped me later top it up with my credit card since the directions/prompts were in French) and were generally great with any questions I had. The front door is locked at night, but someone is always sitting at the desk to let guests in. You can't beat the location of the hotel for the price, I think. It's right across from the stage door of the Bastille, steps from the Metro, a few more steps to the Marais, and walking distance to so much, really. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to my friends as well (Actually, I've already done so).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service”
Reviews.Author: LondonLola
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pavillon for a long w/e in Paris, my husband and I and my parents. We had 2 rooms on the 3rd floor which were nicely decorated and despite being small had all amenities (sat.tv, mini bar, hair dryer in bathroom, nice toiletries, powerful shower...). The bed was very comfy and there were extra pillows. Good soundproofing from the street due to double glazing (couldnt hear the traffic). You could hear the room next door a little bit but it wasnt a problem. The buffet breakfast was great, lovely fresh pastries (croissants, pains au chocolat, all light & buttery) fresh fruits, cereals, toasts, cake, yogurts, eggs (to be boiled to your liking), we really enjoyed the breakfast! there are also drinks & snacks available in the lobby if you want to have a drink on their terrace (unfortunately the weather prevented us from doing so!). The staff is fantastic, friendly and very helpful with recommendations, directions etc. The location is perfect, centre of paris, right by Bastille tube, and plenty of cafes & brasseries on the door step. We would definitely use it again and I've already recommended it to friends. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable, clean, nice location, not expensive”
Reviews.Author: cpdc99
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean. Nice and very friendly staff. Stayed there a few times, business travel, and would stay again. The location is very convenient, close to tube station and the opera. Not too far a way from gare de lion as well. I would stay there again for sure and would recomend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value,great location,very clean,very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rldavo
Reviews.Content: I travel often and like to stay in boutique or small family hotels or 5 star as 5 star hotels try to mimic boutique/family run hotels. Sylvie and her staff made me feel welcome and at home.Sylvie owns and is the manager. Sylvie,s family have runhotels in Paris for 3 generations;grandmother,mother and now Sylvie. The location is excellent in the historic Bastille district just several hundred metres from Bastille place where the French Revolution started (storming of the Bastille Fort). The river Seine is only a hundred meters away and there are several lovely riverside restaurants...lovely romantic evenings spent under the trees by the riverside . I certainly recommend this hotel for its location,its been totally renovated and is modern,clean and charming and good value You wont be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “La Pavillon Bastille---a B&B in Disguise.”
Reviews.Author: VWsurfbug
Reviews.Content: We found the Pavillon Bastille Hotel through Trip Advisor and stayed there for ten nights during April 2010. We liked everything except having to leave and return home. Located in the heart of the trendy district of La Bastille, this charming19th century townhouse turned into boutique hotel is more like a 25-room Bed & Breakfast---a place where you want to hug the innkeeper when you depart. The hotel was entirely renovated in 2007, and the rooms (small by American standards but better than average for Paris) are simply decorated with warm and cheerful colors that make you feel at home. In fact, the contemporary interior design has been awarded for its excellence by “Hotel and Restaurant Design International.” Across from the Opera Bastille, the hotel is a short walk from cinemas, terrace cafes, restaurants and shops. It is only 20 meters from the Bastille Metro, a five-minute walk from Gare de Lyon, and a few steps from the Marais area. Although not in the center of the city, it seemed to us a perfect situation for most anyone visiting Paris. The helpful and friendly day staff (Indunil and Zaia) always greeted us like welcomed friends and guests in someone’s home. They provided us first-class personal service orienting us to Paris, offering sight-seeing and restaurant suggestions, aiding us in making arrangements for tours, giving directions and, in one instance, helping us by phone exchanges to reconnect with our tour van after being lost in a rainstorm for two hours in Versailles. The owner (Sylvie Glade---who lived in the States for two years) and staff we met all spoke fluent English including Indunil and Zaia. In B&B style, they brought us a small bottle of champagne to help celebrate my wife’s 70th birthday and, when she was ill for one day, the owner herself graciously brought her a tray of tea and snacks. Hotel facilities include free Wi-Fi and access to the hotel computer, wide-screen television, minibar, buffet breakfast, a 24-hour Front Deck, Newspapers, Non-Smoking Rooms, Elevator, Safe Deposit Box, Sound-proofed Rooms, Luggage Storage and Air Conditioning. Most important for us was the relatively large bed, spotless housekeeping, and the double paned windows that effectively absorbed any street noise. Among our best memories of Paris are the innkeeper and staff at Le Pavillon Bastille—a B&B in disguise.

Reviews.Title: “Although the location was excellent I wouldn't return.”
Reviews.Author: Hannah S
Reviews.Content: This Hotel met the criteria of what a Hotel should be on most levels, but that said, I will not be returning to it on my next visit to Paris. There was little real warmth from reception and this made approaching the desk a slightly unnerving prospect. Coupled with this was a sense of 'penny-pinching'.....a lack of generosity.....the charges for the mini-bar (located in Reception Area) with charges for a tea bag...a drop of milk ect was mean spirited. This may be 'the norm' in Paris ,but it doesn't have to be. The location opposite the Opera House couldn't have been better, but next time I shall try for a Hotel that appreciates my custom enough to give me a cup of tee for free! On a last not, I brought the key to my room home by mistake; posted them back immediately; received no response. It was that kind of place. H.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: Ailidh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights, 17-21 October 2009. My room - a twin for single occupancy, I just booked a single and this is what I got - was very comfortable and far more spacious than I'd been expecting after all I'd read about tiny Parisian rooms. Room #32 is directly above the courtyard, on the Rue de Lyon side. The double windows are Very Well soundproofed and open over a little balcony front - not a balcony, just a wrought-iron front, very cute. The bathroom was large and clean, with a shower over a nice deep bath. Great mirrors, both in the bathroom and along a whole wall in the bedroom. Just one full-length panel would have been good - ladies going to the opera need to know we look good de cap a pied - I had to stand on the bed to check! Nice little mini-bar, items the usual cost in hotels: €2 for small water, for example. Much cheaper to go to a supermarket of course but not outrageous. The room was very well cleaned every day. In fact, on departure I had to grope under the beds for my mobile phone - still not found it - and there were no dust bunnies at all. There is a safe in the room, and the general security felt good. The desk is attended 24/7, there is a sliding door operated from the desk, and the iron gate from the courtyard is locked at night. Small lift - but again, I've seen smaller. It says for 4 persons: probably not 4 of me buy hey. 2 with luggage, definitely. The hall lights go on instantly you get out of the lift or out of your bedroom. Breakfast was fine, a good enough choice, but ludicrously over-priced at €12. Pleasant wait-staff. My only problem was at checkout, which I chose to do the night before, as I had to leave early. The desk clerk did not know how to work the credit card machine, and, after first of all giving me the wrong price, then said I had to go out and get the cash from a machine. 'Where from?' I asked. 'I don't know. There are many in the city.' As it was now late and pitch black, I declined. Fortunately a senior staff member on her time off looked in and sorted everything in 3 minutes. To give her her due, she had wondered whether he'd be able to manage, being new, and had left what she felt were thorough instructions but it could have been a very nasty end to a great stay, if I'd been forced out to hunt the dark Bastille streets for a cash-point. Even worse if I'd waited until departure, I'd certainly have missed my flight. So, staff-training issues. However, these things happen, and although worth pointing out, did not diminish my enjoyment of my stay. I have already indicated to the hotel that I will be returning in March, and will again and again. The location is very good indeed - 90 seconds walk from a very good metro station, plenty of cafes and restaurants around of a kind that are used to dealing with international visitors but are not tourist dens. Ideal for the opera. (Opera Bastille). Close to L'Open Tour pick up/drop off points. The area is good and bustling, so that if you are out late at night, it does not feel creepy or threatening. I was perfectly happy as a solo female. I read people wanting accommodation 'near The Sights' - but some of the streets near 'The Sights' have such dreadful tourist-tatt shops in; the Bastille area does not feel like that at all. At the price point,€135 per room per night, which is kind of my max. I wouldn't think of looking anywhere else, will happily recommend, will happily return. Late news: I emailed less than an hour ago to ask them to check for my lost phone, and have already received a reply that they are about to post it to me. It is a pleasant and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dmclean1218
Reviews.Content: My oldest son and I stayed in the hotel for 5 nights and couldn't have been happier. The staff is pleasant and very helpful, the room and bathroom were clean and bright, the new windows buffer out the noise from the street. The hotel is across the street from the subway and very close to many cafes and restaurants. The breakfast is good, but a little pricey. All in all, however, it was an excellent value for the money and we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great value at Hotel Pavillon Bastille”
Reviews.Author: dgsaltman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 13 days. Booked months in advance. Since the price went down after I'd booked they graciously threw in breakfast for 2 every day at no cost! Hotel staff could not have been more gracious. Not only did they go out of their way to help us find things to do to fit our interests, they served as on the spot translators when we had to rebook a dinner reservation and got me a doctor the night before our departure when I became ill and really needed a doctor fast (or would not have been able to fly home). Location is fantastic. Minutes' walk to the Metro or Gare de Lyon so that takes care of travel throughout the city but also walking distance to the Marais with lots of fun shops and restaurants. Room was small but bed was large and housekeeping was spotless. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Love to Travel 50
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Pavillon Bastille late in the evening after travelling almost 24 hours, and this may be why the first night we were already making plans to look for a different hotel for the remainder of our stay. But the next morning, although the rooms are very small compared to what you get in the US for the amount of money you pay, the room did not look that bad. It was very clean, the bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom, also small, was very clean as well. The staff was great. They provided us maps and directions for either the subway or the metro to where we wanted to go every mornig whe we asked. Compared to the room our friends stayed at for about $100.00 more a night at another hotel, we really had a great room. Plus, we didn't spend very much time in our room either, we went to Paris to sight see, not to sleep. I would definitely go back. We didn't eat breakfast there because for the price, you could certainly eat somewhere else for less and get a better breakfast. The elevator is very small. We had to make 2 trips seperately to take everything up. The lobby is very small also. Quite frankly, everything is very small, but again it's Paris, and rooms are bound to be small unless you are going to want to spend a fortune for a room. Overall, we were glad we did not look for another hotel, It was near lots of places to eat, and near where we could take the metro and the subway. It was very clean and the staff and the owner were all very nice. We would love to stay again. A good tip though.. if you need a taxi, just flag one down outside because if you have the hotel call one for you, the taxi will charge you about 10 Euros for the reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Desapointing”
Reviews.Author: Gary58
Reviews.Content: Extremely desapointing for a 3 Stars : small rooms very noisy. Not as attractive as photos on reservation site. Not very helpfull staff I certainly will not stay again Gary

Reviews.Title: “A great deal for Paris”
Reviews.Author: ascoltate
Reviews.Content: A great deal for Paris! Although the room was somewhat small, it was totally sufficient for our needs. It is very well located by the Bastille, and close in particular to the Marais. It was recommended to me by a friend and it is quite a find. My partner noted that the staff does not really speak English (I speak French, so I didn't notice), but they are very helpful. Everything is modern and in good condition.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Pavillon Bastille
HotelInfo.Address: 65, rue de Lyon | 12th Arr., 75012 Paris, France
